decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Wasteland. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game using cheap, efficient spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for the right cards and maintain pressure on the opponent. It also has a few one-of cards like Unholy Heat and Brazen Borrower for additional versatility and flexibility in dealing with various threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to ramp into powerful threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Questing Beast. It also includes disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Collector Ouphe to slow down opponents. The deck has a toolbox approach with Green Sun's Zenith to search for specific creatures like Gaddock Teeg or Knight of Autumn based on the situation. Wasteland and Renegade Rallier provide additional utility and resilience, while Mother of Runes offers protection for key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to use Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield early. By using cards like Sneak Attack and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to react. The inclusion of cards like Pentad Prism and Lotus Petal helps ramp up mana quickly to cast these high-cost creatures, and cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm provide protection against opposing disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing those creatures back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. It includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect key combo pieces and disruption like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. It also has card draw and selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces. The deck aims to win the game by quickly reanimating powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through disruption, removal, and counter spells while also efficiently drawing cards and generating value through card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, remove threats with Swords to Plowshares, and generate card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also has powerful finishers in Roiling Dragonstorm, Murktide Regent, and Clarion Conqueror to close out the game once the opponent is sufficiently controlled.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage through artifact spells and abilities, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to assemble powerful artifact synergies, such as using Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly recur artifacts like Mox Opal and The One Ring, while utilizing cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the opponent's board. The goal is to generate a significant advantage and close out the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful board presence through artifact ramp and recursion while disrupting opponents' game plans with counter spells and card draw. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Paradox Engine, the deck can generate significant mana and card advantage to overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of Aetherflux Reservoir and Lavaspur Boots provide alternate win conditions, making the deck versatile in different matchups. The key strategy is to efficiently play artifacts and control the game tempo to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon while quickly deploying powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and The One Ring to close out the game. The deck also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent's game plan, allowing the aggressive creatures to deal damage efficiently. With the help of cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful plays to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The creatures in the deck are high impact, with options like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty providing powerful effects when reanimated. The deck aims to overpower the opponent with big threats early in the game, while also having some interaction and card draw to stay ahead.
